Package paintingcanvas.painter

Class App.AnimationBuilder

java.lang.Object
paintingcanvas.painter.App.AnimationBuilder
Enclosing class:
App
protected static class App.AnimationBuilder extends Object
This class provides various methods to construct and schedule animations. You can create an instance of the class by simply: 
 obj.animate();
Then you are free to call any of the below methods on it to start adding animations. These methods include .add(), .with(), and .schedule().
You should use .add() and .with() for simpler animations. .add() waits until all animations finish before running, and .with() runs the animation right now, with any previous .add() animations, which allows you to run multiple animations at the same time. That's probably confusing so see this piece of code down here: 
 // these three animations will happen all at the same time
 square.animate()
       .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
       .with(colorTo(Color.RED), 100);
 circle.animate()
       .with(colorTo(color.BLUE), 100);

 // this animation will happen after all the previous animations finish
 text.animate.add(rotateTo(360), 100);
as a shorthand, instead of .animate().add() you can instead just use .animate() 
 square.animate(colorTo(Color.RED), 100);
Since .add() and .with() are blocking, you can use .schedule() to manually specify when animations run for more complicated animations.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public App.AnimationBuilder add(Animation animation, float duration, TimeUnit unit)
      Add an animation to an object. If there are any currently running animations it waits until those finish before running. This ensures that whenever you call .add(), this animation will run after any .add()'s or .with()'s before it. 
       // these animations will run one after the other
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);
      Parameters:
      animation - The animation type to add
      duration - The amount of time the animation will last
      Returns:
      this to allow method chaining

    • add

      public App.AnimationBuilder add(Animation animation, float duration)

    • with

      public App.AnimationBuilder with(Animation animation, float duration, TimeUnit unit)
      Add the animation alongside / with the previous animation. 
       // these animations will run at the same time
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .with(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);
      Parameters:
      animation - The animation type to add
      duration - The amount of time the animation will last
      Returns:
      this to allow method chaining

    • with

      public App.AnimationBuilder with(Animation animation, float duration)

    • wait

      public App.AnimationBuilder wait(float duration, TimeUnit unit)
      Adds the next animation frame frames after it normally would. 
       // the second animation will run 50 frames after the first one finishes
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(50)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);

 // the second animation will run 50 frames after the first one starts
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(50)
    .with(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);
      Parameters:
      duration - Frames to wait
      Returns:
      this to allow method chaining

    • wait

      public App.AnimationBuilder wait(float duration)

    • wait

      public App.AnimationBuilder wait(int duration)

    • schedule

      public App.AnimationBuilder schedule(float time, Animation animation, float duration, TimeUnit unit)
      Add the animation at the end of the animation queue. If there's no previous animations it adds the animation now. 
       // this animation will run 50 frames from now and
 // last for 100 frames, ending 150 frames from now
 obj.animate()
    .schedule(50, moveTo(100, 100), 100)
      Parameters:
      time - frames, after now, to add the animation
      animation - The animation type to add
      duration - The amount of time the animation will last
      Returns:
      this to allow method chaining

    • schedule

      public App.AnimationBuilder schedule(float time, Animation animation, float duration)

    • schedule

      public App.AnimationBuilder schedule(float time, Event.EventRunner runner, TimeUnit unit, boolean repeat)

    • schedule

      public App.AnimationBuilder schedule(float time, boolean repeat, Event.EventRunner runner)
